senses.sense: The 4<sup>th</sup> letter of the English alphabet, called dee and written in the Latin script.
The ordinal number 4<sup>th</sup>, derived from this letter of the English alphabet, called dee and written in the Latin script.

examples: Do you have the answer for 23d?

senses.sense: (Malaysia)(informal) Abbreviation of already. Used to form the perfect tenses. Used in text messages.
(until February 1971) a British penny; an old penny (the modern decimal penny being abbreviated p).

examples: d20 — a specialized die with twenty sides
2d6 — the sum of the roll of two six-sided dice

senses.sense: penny, a measure of the size of nails
